choices.D: The SSL inspection needs to be a deep content inspection.
choices.A: Add Facebook in the URL category in the security policy.
choices.B: Additional application signatures are required to add to the security policy.
choices.C: Force access to Facebook using the HTTP service.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibits.
Exhibit A.
//IMG//

Exhibit B.
//IMG//

The exhibits show the SSL and authentication policy (Exhibit A) and the security policy (Exhibit B) for Facebook.
Users are given access to the Facebook web application. They can play video content hosted on Facebook but they are unable to leave reactions on videos or other types of posts.
Which part of the policy configuration must you change to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. The SSL inspection needs to be a deep content inspection.

https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
answer is D.

comments.content: Add to clarify beter ==> Cuando aparece el candado en una application signature indica que requiere de SSL Deep inspection. discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
They seem to mean the likes function with the "unable to react" part of the question?
It's quite unclear since the question does not mention likes but reactions..

comments.content: Yes, i get your point and i agree. But an advice for this and others exams, try not to overthink things, most of the questions are intended to be very straight forward. In this case, "reactions" includes likes, and the like button function requires Deep Inspection to be allowed (you can see the Lock icon next to it, it indicates that Deep Inspection is a MUST).

choices.A: Any number of virtual wire pairs can be included, as long as the policy traffic direction is the same.
choices.C: Any number of virtual wire pairs can be included in each policy, regardless of the policy traffic direction settings.
choices.B: Only a single virtual wire pair can be included in each policy.
choices.D: Exactly two virtual wire pairs need to be included in each policy.

Selected Answer: C
For non native English speaking, thican be confused. 
the original statement is: 
This allows each user group to try and authenticate users against the RADIUS server if local authentication fail

Selected Answer: C
C. This option places the RADIUS server, and all users who can authenticate against that server, into every FortiGate user group. 

FortiGate Security 7.2 Study Guide (p.146):
"The Include in every User Group option adds the RADIUS server and all users that can authenticate against it, to every user group created on FortiGate. So, you should enable this option only in very specific scenarios (for example, when only administrators can authenticate against the RADIUS server and policies are ordered from least restrictive to most restrictive)."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
answer is C.
The answer is C
C is correct. Page 227 Fortigate Security 7.0

Selected Answer: C
Optional setting to add the RADIUS server to each user group.

This allows each user group to try and authenticate users against the RADIUS server if local authentication fails.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit, which contains a radius server configuration.
//IMG//

An administrator added a configuration for a new RADIUS server. While configuring, the administrator selected the Include in every user group option.
What will be the impact of using Include in every user group option in a RADIUS configuration?

choices.D: This option places the RADIUS server, and all users who can authenticate against that server, into every RADIUS group.
choices.C: This option places the RADIUS server, and all users who can authenticate against that server, into every FortiGate user group.
choices.A: This option places all FortiGate users and groups required to authenticate into the RADIUS server, which, in this case, is FortiAuthenticator.
choices.B: This option places all users into every RADIUS user group, including groups that are used for the LDAP server on FortiGate.

questions.question_text:
By default, FortiGate is configured to use HTTPS when performing live web filtering with FortiGuard servers.
Which CLI command will cause FortiGate to use an unreliable protocol to communicate with FortiGuard servers for live web filtering?

discussion.content: there is an error it should be answer A and D but with "set protocol udp" and not tcp.

Selected Answer: A
Only A should be valid, as far as I understand.
Its D. set protocol tcp!

Selected Answer: A
A. set fortiguard-anycast disable

FortiGate Security 7.2 Study Guide (p.288):
"By default, FortiGate is configured to enforce the use of HTTPS port 443 to perform live filtering with FortiGuard or FortiManager. Other ports and protocols are available by disabling the FortiGuard anycast setting on the CLI."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-security-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html

Selected Answer: A
The question is only asking for a single answer, TCP to is a reliable transport protocol so whom ever is choosing this needs to think about a career change.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

Selected Answer: A
A correct

Selected Answer: A
Only A is correct. The question states unreliable (UDP). There is only 1 correct answer for this one.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
Tcp is not unreliable, should be only the A.

Selected Answer: A
config system fortiguard
 set fortiguard-anycast disable
 set protocol udp
 set port 53
end

Selected Answer: A
Should be A

comments.content: The trick is when mentioned in these page "other ports and protocols are available by diasabling the fortiguard anycast setting on the cli" These refeer diferent to HTTPS port 443, because this is by default

discussion.content: A, FortiGate security 7.0 Study Guide, page 422.

By default, "fortiguard-anycast" is enabled, and this setting only works with "set protocol https".
To use udp (ie. "set protocol udp"), "fortiguard-anycast" must be disabled.

Selected Answer: A
"By default, FortiGate is configured to enforce the use of HTTPS port 443 to perform live filtering with FortiGuard or FortiManager. Other ports and protocols are available by disabling the FortiGuard anycast setting on the CLI."

Fortigate Security Study Guide v7.0, Page 417

Selected Answer: A
Only asking for one answer so A
The answer is only A, but if D is 'set protocol udp' not tcp is also correct
Yes, A is correct.

questions.question_text: Which two configuration settings are synchronized when FortiGate devices are in an active-active HA cluster? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
A. NTP
B. DNS 

FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide (p.306):
"Not all the configuration settings are synchronized. There are a few that are not, such as:
• System interface settings of the HA reserved management interface and the HA default route for the reserved management interface
• In-band HA management interface
• HA override
• HA device priority
• Virtual cluster priority
• FortiGate hostname
• HA priority setting for a ping server (or dead gateway detection) configuration
• All licenses except FortiToken licenses (serial numbers)
• Cache"

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html
answer is A & B

comments.content: But there is difference between TTL and NTP, the latter one is a server and TTl is a value

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
NTP is itself time sync.
